Body:
I have a set of sentences from which I want to extract all the subjective phrases.

For eg., from I am pleased to learn that the president has been reelected., I want to extract am pleased. What is the way to do that?

Edit: So each sentence can be divided into subjective and objective phrases. For example in the sentence:

Barack Obama is the President of the USA but I don't think he's doing a good job.

Here, the first part, Barack Obama is the President of the USA is the objective part of the phrase as it states the fact but I don't think he's doing a good job is the subjective part of the phrase which gives the sentiment. I want to extract all such subjective phrases from a bunch of sentences. What I have access to is a bunch of documents which have sentences with corresponding documents already containing the subjective phrases present in these documents. I need to find a method which I can use to understand how these subjective phrases are constructed so that I can extract subjective phrases from a new set of sentences/documents. If anyone is aware of some papers or any other sources dealing with this, it would be of great help.
Title: Extracting subjective phrases from sentences
